content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a good one, the only thing i'd maybe change is the way to write the answer, cause formating in HH:00 format can be a pain in certain languages.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: nice and fun

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good clash, nothing to note üëç

Most likely a me problem, but I couldn't understand that 09:00-17:00, 23:00-07:00 were exclusive from the get-go.

Maybe it's worth mentioning? Will approve this regardless.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
I had mistaken the example output to mean that both you and your friend are free from 07:00 to 17:00. It's a good clash though :)

Constraints
* Please change "[[xxxx_timezone]]" to "[[my_timezone]], [[friends_timezone]]".

Cases
* The answer is always "Impossible" whenever one of the time zones is 0, or when the time zone difference is 16 hours or 6 hours in the current cases. Consider:
  ‚Ä¢ adding a pair of "Impossible" cases where the time zone difference is neither 16 hours nor 6 hours.
  ‚Ä¢ modifying/adding a pair of non-"Impossible" cases where one or both time zones are 0.

Thanks.

Some code I wrote to get the answers for all possible combinations (the output has a quite beautiful pattern to it):
https://ato.pxeger.com/run?1=hVLRSsMwFAUf-xWXjMk21tBVQR0M8UXYs765UdL1Zr3SpiVJxbntS3zZg_6UX2NaHZtaMBCS3Jxz7rnJfX3TVbza7d4rK_3Lj5O0A1NlUSthqVAig5snQZmIKSO7grtFikmVoQYf7tFYWKJCLWyhPS9fRZZyfCkUwgQCcKMDt_QMNiUzBENqgbBIhVqSWkJc2BTIgHZ6KhHKejISWjvmw8AfhZyPwrknCw1SE6rEHLRJQQP1APaxKCEpUWOdYfKX4cORN8_x3FFqxCgtKm2alBec86shDEb1JjybO9Be5h8kz0W5hk0N2AD06tUlbHHWhy6E57BtDFS2Eln2y8ZPW6ctDmpuqUlZYO21d9Yt8e14ZmeW1WSSbbk55qVdXXv1n5WVNcCmeVkYQ3GGzEUxM3i4bBM4fgTWDcJkHATMFdw8x5Y_FqR6DFi_FlOJ5-ZXw3333b7_PgE

I made this clash because I've been trying to call a friend with whom I have a timezone difference of 8 hours and it's been pretty much impossible, as my code now demonstrates. :P

Thanks, I've changed the constraint and implemented the last suggestion.

Adding more impossible cases is something I'm avoiding for now though, because it makes submitting 'print("Impossible")' more and more likely to get a medium score/rank in Fastest mode. To offset this, I'd need to make more tests with real outputs, but I feel like 10 is already about as many as a clash should have before it gets annoying...

The impossible cases are symmetric with respect to the time zone difference (e.g. +6 = -6, -16=+8=-8=+16 -- all of these are impossible). So in that sense the only impossible case I've not covered is -7=+7, but I figured by testing 6 and 8 I was ensuring clashers got both 'edges' of the impossible zone and would naturally have the inside too. If I really wanted to cover every impossible case I'd need at least 3 impossible cases (6,7,8), 6 if I want to account for +/- and 12 if I want to account for -16/+16, -17/+17, -18/+18. I could halve it by testing for different differences in validators vs tests, but I wanted to avoid that...
Good point, I've reworded it to say "we are both unavailable from {{09:00}} to {{17:00}} (work) and from {{23:00}} to {{07:00}} (sleep) in our respective timezones"

Thanks for approving. Can you think of a good way to succintly mention that these bounds are inclusive of the start hour but exclusive of the end hour? I thought about making it explicit, but it seemed like it would just make the statement more complicated-looking.

I had hoped that by having 17:00 in the example answer that it would make it clear that 17:00-18:00 is available.

Thanks for the approval and feedback.

Do you know which languages it's quite hard in? I'd like to see how hard it can be. I figured all CG languages have access to a string formatter like `sprintf`, but there's a lot of langs I'm not familiar with.

24-hour time is ideal here and it's customary to use HH:MM format, so I'm hesitant to change it but the clash is already on the hard side, so I see the value of removing the formatting obstacle for outputs.

Edit: I decided to just change it. Making this a bit less complicated will help newer coders solve it within 15 minutes. Thanks for the suggestion.

I can only think of one of these two:
1- "both end hours are exclusive"
2- Specify the booked hours in 2 separate lines instead:
"Work: 09:00-17:00 (End hour exclusive)"
"Sleep: 23:00- 07:00 (End hour exclusive)"

Or if both sound off, then as you said, they can just figure it out by reading the first testcase

I found 1 might be hard to understand, while 2 would make the statement too long, but thought of a 3rd option thanks to your feedback, which I've edited in now:

[...] we are both unavailable from 09:00 to 17:00 (work) and from 23:00 to 07:00 (sleep) in our respective timezones (i.e. available from 07:00 to 09:00 and 17:00 to 23:00).
Yep, that does sound much better. Thanks for your responsiveness.
